user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 14.3 is: Controlling expressions shall not be invariant.
Here are exceptions to this rule:
1. Invariants that are used to create infinite loops are permitted.
2. A do-while loop with an essentially Boolean controlling expression that evaluates to false and satisfies the constraints and semantics for an integer constant expression is permitted.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_MutSemDelete_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_MutSemDelete_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    int                              status;
    OS_impl_mutex_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_mutex_table, *token);

    status = pthread_mutex_destroy(&(impl->id)); /* 0 = success */

    if (status != 0)
    {
        return OS_SEM_FAILURE;
    }

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_MutSemDelete_Impl:
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
OS_impl_mutex_internal_record_t OS_impl_mutex_table[OS_MAX_MUTEXES]
...
typedef struct
{
    pthread_mutex_t id;
} OS_impl_mutex_internal_record_t
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
#define OS_SEM_FAILURE (-6)
...
#define OS_SUCCESS (0)
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: I inspected the entire function and related symbols. MISRA C:2023 Rule 14.3 concerns invariant controlling expressions in loop constructs (for, while, do-while). The target function OS_MutSemDelete_Impl contains no loop constructs — only an assignment from pthread_mutex_destroy and an if statement: if (status != 0). That controlling expression is not invariant because status is set at runtime by pthread_mutex_destroy. The OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET macro expands to an array indexing expression and is not a loop control expression. No do-while with an essentially-Boolean constant, no for(;;) or while(1) infinite-loop constructs are present. Therefore there are no code fragments in the provided code that need investigation for Rule 14.3.
